review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019
review_title: Digital action hero in boxer briefs, right here.

one_reviews_text: Amazing for the price and for what it is, but still not quite a replacement for PCVR, if you have the money to support PCVR that is. An amazing starting point for those just getting into VR, and an awesome continuation for those tired of the cables and setup required for PCVR. A little uncomfortable, still blurry in some circumstances, and the speakers are passable at best, but when you take into account that this is an entire 6 DOF VR experience all built into a headset, you can forgive the shortcomings.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 June 2019
review_title: Amazing for the price and for what it is, but still not quite a replacement for PCVR

one_reviews_text: For what it is: a completely mobile VR gaming rig — it’s fantastic.  I’ve had an amazing time playing with it and it’s so easy to set up and play my non-techie girlfriend has no trouble with setup and playing.Cons:It’s pretty uncomfortable to wear. I dunno how they missed the mark but it’s just ... not great. Battery life is decent, at about two hours, which would be ok except for the fact that it takes about that long to recharge it. For comfort and batt life implementing a battery-pack counter-weight improves things considerably.The mobile process is underpowered. That’s not to say that games are good but by going with an older platform ( ostensibly to save money) they sacrificed resolution. The speakers sometimes crap-out, especially when the rig is being taxed.Tracking is excellent, however, and while maybe ‘lower’ resolution, the games I’ve played are smooth, engaging, and so much fun. In most cases, it just works and well!I am overall very happy with my purchase and excited about the future of VR gaming.Oh— I’m a software developer and almost 50!  😀
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 June 2019
review_title: Great but. Works very with a couple tiny glitches SO worth wireless VR gaming!

one_reviews_text: My first time using this was one of those once-in-a-lifetime moments you never forget.  I cannot believe technology has advanced this far.  I am totally blown away by it.  TOTAL IMMERSION.Shortly afterwards I brought it to a party and everyone got into it.Honestly, I think it was worth the price just for the experience alone.  It's about what you'd pay for a family to go to one of those immersion rides at Universal Studios or something.  Instead, you can use it every day!The Google Earth function is also pretty awesome.  It's like you're anywhere in the world.  Try visiting the top of Mount Everest and looking around!  You won't believe it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 November 2019
review_title: Most fun I've had in years.  WOW.  It was like being on the Starship Enterprise in the holodeck

one_reviews_text: Pros:* easy to set up and use* no additional equipment needed* good stability of VR world while moving one's headCon:* limited frame rate and image detailThe Oculus Quest does a pretty good job for its price.  In a few years it will probably seem hopelessly antiquated and crude, but it's good enough to use and enjoy today.  The illusion of a virtual world is convincing enough that I have to get my bearings when I remove the headset.  Most users may see it primarily as a gaming device, and the Quest comes with a small set of demo games, but it can also be used to stream 3D videos.  Be prepared to encounter encouragement to buy games and connect to social media.To use the Quest you must create an Oculus account, but a traditional Facebook account is not required -- if there's a difference, given that Facebook owns Oculus.  Consider the Quest to be like an early PC or an early smartphone: good enough to use, but not (yet) the ultimate VR device.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 November 2019
review_title: a good entry point into VR

one_reviews_text: The VR experience is amazing. It's pretty easy to get lost in the experience and time just slips by. Actual usage is primarily limited by the number of games/titles. Would love to see more concert and live sporting events for viewing. One note of caution is if you've had Lasik with different focal lengths in each eye, it's difficult to find a good focus with the Oculus. When I had my Lasik, the focus distance for my eyes were not made the same so that I could have vision far away and up close. Otherwise, I would have lost my near vision. The brain eventually resolves this difference. However, with the Oculus, it's difficult to find the right focal point because both eyepieces move together. It would be ideal if each eyepiece could be adjusted separately for optimum focus.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 May 2020
review_title: Great experience, need more games/titles, be wary if you have had Lasik

one_reviews_text: First, wow when I got this I was so excited for it but slowly its letting me down with three things really. Tracking, tracking and tracking. Man I cannot play Beat Saber without it losing tracking. Ive only had it for 2 weeks maybe. And it just keeps getting worse. Ive looked into all the reasons it could be happening, clean the cameras, big room, lots of light. Expert mode on Quest is impossible, the left side (red saber) is the worse it seems. It just disappears sometimes as I'm about to hit a block. Just stops tracking for a second. Maybe I have a defective piece of machinery, I dont know. The game itself will hiccup too. It just freezes and starts up again randomly during times. I haven't found anyone else having this issue yet. But it makes me not want it anymore. I cant do what I want on it. Are their external tracking set ups I can get? Should I just send it back? Should I wait for the new generation or next one? Im not having fun when it happens, very disappointed. I would love to write more or even write things I like about it but that gets shadowed right now by this tracking issue. Hope yours runs better then mine, its just like me to get the one defective Quest. Everyone else's Quest works but mine.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 September 2019
review_title: Having more issues then I thought...

one_reviews_text: I purchased this device as an entry level VR set and so far it has exceeded my expectations.Prior to the Oculus Quest I only used smart phone VR and Google Day Dream and Oculus Quest takes the cake. With the recent additions of Oculus Link I can see Oculus putting a lot of Effort for updates in the future and with the recent retirement of Oculus GO the Quest is looking like it will only grow from here on out. The portability is also awesome especially to demo at family events.So far my recommendations for the Quest are as follows:-SuperHot- An amazing first person shooter where time moves when you do. A great mechanic.-Beat Saber- Great for the whole family including grandparents.-Accounting+ a fun puzzle adventure from the creator of Rick and Morty.-Rec Room- Great fun for little ones and even adults. I spent so much time just playing dodge ball against my little cousins on PSVR.I strongly recommend for anyone interested in VR and doesn't want to break the bank.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 June 2020
review_title: Great entry level VR and great for VR Vets.

one_reviews_text: I bought one of these after following a few Youtubers who owned them.  I finally saved up and bought the Quest and was not disappointed at all.  In fact I was blown away by what this device can do for you.  I not only play games on this device but you can download videos that transport you to other places and you really feel you’re there!  I downloaded the Norte Dame Cathedral video and was transported to Paris, France in a matter of minutes.  I love my Quest and am glad I purchased it.  I can take any stressful day, slip on the Quest and disappear into VR for a few hours.  It actually has lowered my blood pressure while I was in the fishing games.  I had been out of the gaming scene for many years and this device has sold me on VR.  If you have the money, buy one.  You won’t be disappointed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 February 2020

one_reviews_text: Had to return my ment to be bought new, Quest. Had a previous user's profile already loaded and had to factory reset it. Spent most of the night trying to get it to connect to PC with link, only to find out is usb port was broken and kept losing connection to the computer on and off. I saved up for about 2 1/2 months to even order this. I was trying to buy new to avoid having issues and have everything work smoothly. Now I am without a Quest, and am not sure when I'll even be able to acquire a new one at retail again. Very upset with Amazon not checking what they ship before shipping it. So stuck without. So again I say buyer beware. Make sure its new and working correctly.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 September 2020
review_title: Beware return resales sold as new.

one_reviews_text: It’s pretty freaking sweet! I have zero issues with this and quite honestly better than actually gaming on a console or PC. My only thing is sometimes I feels blurry but I am not sure if it's because that’s just how it looks or because it’s not sitting right. I’m assuming it’s cause it’s not sitting in the “sweet spot” as they say so I’m gonna go with user error. It’s a lot of money to dish out but it’s brandnew what do you expect 🤷🏼‍♂️. Honestly if you’re thinking about it and alreadybinterested chances are you know what you’re getting into and have tried out VR. GET IT. the 64gb version is perfect for everyone the only time you’d need more is if you’re side loading other media like movies or side loading other games etc.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Bought as a present and it was a hit. Pictures are so real looking as if you were there. Does not come with headphones so everyone can hear what is playing. Unless you lower it and where is the fun in that. Game pictures on box are NOT included. Those are samples. You can buy a game or download some for free. You do not need to register this Oculus to Facebook at this time but in the future you may have to. I bought the 64GB to save some money instead of the 124GB.  No Regrets but it was pricy.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 August 2020

one_reviews_text: I currently play Pistol Whip, Dance Central, and Beat Saber. I followed an online tutorial to get custom songs on Beat Saber.  My SO likes Pirate Hunter Trainer and SuperHot.The battery life is really good and I usually charge it after about two 1 1/2 play sessions. The batteries for hands has lasted a long time!With the right case it's super portable and a Google Chromecast let's you project to the TV for parties or having friends over.I am a small female and about at the 1 1/2 mark is when it starts to feel heavy on my head. I'll be getting an extra strap to help with that in the future. I haven't experienced any motion sickness but sometimes I do get a pit in my stomach when it feels like I'm about to fall off a fake ledge.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2020

one_reviews_text: I wanted an all-in-one VR headset and this baby does not disappoint!Pros: This is an incredibly immersive experience! Nothing like I've ever experienced before. This is the VR we were promised in the 90s. There are plenty of games, from first-person shooters, to aerobic dancing and saber games (that don't feel like exercise!), to 3D movies, historical site visits, and so much more.Cons: It's a little heavy, especially after an hour of use. It also has about an hour of battery life, and I suppose that helps not to binge too long. You can plug it in for extended play.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 June 2020

one_reviews_text: Gotta be one of the most unique and fun experiences I've ever had. I've been playing video games since I was a kid and I'd heard about VR. Oh man, I've been missing out big time. This is some cutting edge stuff, and it's not kidding when people say that it's immersive. It's really hard to explain what makes it so good other than saying that it makes you feel like you're actually in the game. Just get one, you won't regret it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 August 2020
review_title: One of the best purchases I've ever made... for gaming

one_reviews_text: Well, truth be told, this headset didn't leave me speechless. All I could say when using it was "wooooow", "oh my goodness", and "you gotta try this!" I've become a VR evangelist. I literally take it anywhere I can and have my friends and family try it out (the more people get interested in VR, the better the market gets)! If you have any doubts about this, buy from Amazon or Best Buy and return it if you're not absolutely amazed.You gotta see it to believe it! I have an Oculus Go and an Oculus Quest. You don't really NEED both but they're very different in terms of their use. Buy this one at least and then, once you are convinced, buy the Oculus Go for the casual VRing experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 July 2019
review_title: How do you write a review for a product that leaves you speechless?

one_reviews_text: I bought it on day one, and showed it to everyone in the office. Everyone loved it and many are considering buying it. This is the product that could drive mass VR adoption. The only potential downside is the lack of killer apps like the legend of zelda or mario did for the switch.However, with games like beat saber, robo recall, orbus, dead and buried, I expect you to die, there are plenty of great experiences on here you can play for a long time. But nothing with the long run time and triple A quality of a first party nintendo game. This is written in may 2019, potentially other games could come to the quest and change that, for instance storm lands could.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 May 2019
review_title: Extremely convenient, everyone I have shown it to loves it

one_reviews_text: The pentile matrix of the Quest despite its 1600p resolution caused uncomfortably apparent SDE for me. I noticed it more than the $200 Oculus Go.  I understand for most people this is not critical as most hmd's suffer this, but I don't expect a downgrade in SDE when I intend to upgrade.  Yes it has deeper blacks, but I'm not playing those dark games, and the dark grey of other headsets never bothered me. Switching to the HP reverb was the solution for my specific use cases.Note: for most people, the Quest or Rift S is a better unit all things considered for gaming only. But I privilege screen over everything else. And since the Reverb thus far can do everything reasonably well, not perfectly but satisfactorily, and has a fantastic screen compared to the others, I'm now set.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Too heavy. The thing kept wanting to slide down my face unless I tightened it to the point of it hurting my face. With or without the glasses spacer, it lets light in which causes odd halo effects.Quality is not significantly better than the Rift that I already have. In a dim room or a room shaded on one side, the tracking can get very shaky. I'd rather just have sensor bars and a steady view.Screen door effect is fairly strong. Focus blurs as the unit slides down the face, so considering the weight of the unit I found myself holding it up with my hand just t o get a steady image.Nice try, Facebook, but the hype doesn't meet the product in my hands. Maybe VR needs time to grow, or maybe I need a higher end unit.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 February 2020
review_title: Too heavy, not enough improvement over Rift

one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing and fun device for all ages! Rated four stars because of the slightly "fuzzy" imagery. However, I suspect/hope this will be improved to a crisper image with future generations of the device. This is also something to be used with caution for those that get motion sickness as easily as I do. There are only a a few games/apps that I can enjoy without triggering a headache. I highly recommend adjusting the setting for less likelihood of motion problems, but some games just have to be avoided altogether. Lastly, the device is heavy and can become uncomfortable to wear on the forehead, cheekbones, and neck after awhile. Hopefully, they will also become lighter weight in the future. All in all, though, our family loves this and there's something fun for all of us to enjoy...from games to meditations and everything in between!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 March 2020

one_reviews_text: Problem 1: I got my oculus a couple days ago new. everything was working just fine. i set it up and put in the batteries that CAME WITH the oculus quest. i played for a day and it was amazing. The next day i was playing and the right controller stopped working. i thought it wasn’t that big of a deal and just took them out and put them back in. The controller didn’t work still. so i took them out again and noticed the batteries were LEAKING OUT. i was really worried. i went and got new batteries and put them in, didn’t work. so i tried cleaning the controller out with rubbing alcohol, didn’t work. i wasn’t paying $70 for a new one so i was going to message oculus about my problem. but couldn’t find anything to message them on. then i tried to find there number but couldn’t find that either. i found something about submitting a ticket to them, then wait 1-2 days to see if they would respond. i gave my controller a couple hours to rest and would come back to it later. i came back and it didn’t work. so i cleaned it out again and let it sit for a couple minutes. then i was about to submit my ticket but i put the battery back in and it worked. i let it sit for a while then i came back and started playing. It’s been 2 days and it’s been working fine. whenever i take the batteries out and put them back in it won’t work sometimes so i’ll just try again and it will be fine. i’m still very upset about this and i’m sorry for other customers with this problem.Problem 2: this isn’t a big problem but i’d like the put it out there. whenever i try to cast my oculus to my phone it never works. it’s only worked once by casting through my oculus to my phone. but it doesn’t work now. then i’ve tried casting through my phone and it says something will pop up on the oculus but i get nothing. i hope i can fix this problem.other than that the oculus is an amazing device and i love it. i would give it 5 stars if i didn’t have those problems though.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 February 2020

one_reviews_text: This thing is a blast. You really can’t get an impression of what it’s like from YouTube videos. Really a game changer!Only two minor issues: the lenses are blurred at the sides, but fortunately the “sweet spot” is sizable enough that it isn’t an issue. Just something to expect before you buy. Also, my eye-width slider only goes down to 59, but tends to stay at around 60. Supposed to bottom-out at 58.Strap a battery pack on the back with some velcro tape and it adds substantial playtime before needing to plug it into a wall, plus it acts as a counter balance!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Ok, I would like to start of by saying this is a good product, it is a good vr headset. However, it really annoyed me that Oculus decided to sell a prototype headset for ~$400 and release a better, cheaper version, maybe a year later, with little warning. Again, this thing is a good product, I’m just really pissed off. The negatives of this product are same with most other consoles, freezing, crashing, occasional bugs, but there are some worse things. A couple months ago mine had a software update and it caused it to black screen, everything went black and I couldn’t do anything with the headset, so I had to factory reset the thing, and occasionally  when I tried  to launch games the headset just shut off, these problems have smoothed out and are less of a problem recently. All in all, just buy the newer cheaper, better one if you getting a quest. A dick move from Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 September 2021

one_reviews_text: I have a vr ready pc, but I have never used a vr headset before. I was picking between this and the rift s because the quest seems like a lot of fun. I was worried about performance issues, framerates, and the refresh rate of the screen. None of these were an issue. Framerates was great, the Hertz of the screen is really nice, and I have not experienced performance issues. If you have never ever experienced vr, you have a vr ready pc, you travel, and you are picking between this and the rift s, go with the quest. Expect around 2-3 hours of play time with games like job simulator, superhot, and beatsaber.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2019
review_title: Nothing I expected, but in a good way.

one_reviews_text: Beware though, this version will not run VR chat very well.Still, for starting out with VR it is a nice entry point.It's important to note that unless you already have an Oculus account predating 2021 you will be forced to link your Facebook profile to the headset. The same applies to Oculus quest 2 which is a better purchase rn if you don't mind the intrusive FB login.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 June 2021
review_title: I like it, it doesn't run everything as well as I'd wish but I recommend it

one_reviews_text: It's unclear why so many Amazon stores are allowed to buy up the world's inventory at retail then sell for $130 more. If this were an essential item during a global disaster, this would be price-gouging. Why can't they buy wholesale and sell at the retail price? This business model will not last as I will pre-order whenever possible. That being said,  Michael's had the earliest delivery promise under Amazon Prime and no extra charge for 2 day shipping, which has been slipping due to Covid-19.  I was shocked that Michael's shipped it the day of the order (Saturday) and it arrived Monday. I'm so happy to have this now when most other inventory is gone. Maybe the extra week or two of use was worth the extra hundred. It's a fantastic product. The tracking within a playspace is what makes this mind-blowing beyond other VR. It will remember the map you created. You can walk from room to room physically while moving in the virtual world. I like to put furniture where the virtual furniture is and take a seat when needed. The headset is front heavy and hurts my head and face. I had to find the best balance and also used a scarf as a headband. The experience is worth it, but don't play too long. Take breaks. Adjust the pressure on your face frequently. You will get used to it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2020
review_title: Mind blowing VR experience. Pre-order or buy at retail when possible. Price-gouging is rampant.

one_reviews_text: This is probably one of the best value VR headsets on the market. It's important to recognize that Oculus released an Oculus Link cable(basically a high quality USB-C), which allows games from the PC to be played without the limitation of the Oculus Quest store while still retaining the portability. The battery can last for a few hours, but you will want to charge it pretty often. The controllers don't burn through batter that quickly, and it's intuitive to use. I haven't had any frame issues or the screen door effect, and it fits with glasses well too. It's lightweight and there can be no cords involved, making the VR experience much more liberating and enjoyable.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 May 2020

one_reviews_text: I own the Oculus Go and the Oculus Quest. I picked up the Quest because of the better resolution, hoping to view videos shot on my Insta360 EVO camera. I assumed that the apps available in the Oculus Go and Quest store would be the same. I was wrong.The app to view video directly from the EVO is available for the Go but not for the Quest. Apparently the Go is considered an entry-level device by Oculus - made for watching videos and playing some light games - and the Quest is built for more hardcore VR gaming. There are other gaps in the apps available on the store as well, but for my purposes this one was the most annoying.I understand that there can be hardware limitations on the Go, but the Quest is their flagship product - anything that runs on the Go will run in the Quest. Not offering the same apps that run on the Go and trying to pigeonhole users into different categories is short-sighted on Oculus’s part.Other than that, the Quest is well built, the graphics and sound are excellent, and the interface is well executed. If you’re buying the Quest or the Go for a specific purpose, make sure the apps you want to run are available on the device you choose.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 January 2020
review_title: The Oculus Quest and the Go stores don’t carry the same apps.

one_reviews_text: I ordered this for a Santa gift for my kids. Product arrived quickly. Box was in great condition. Batteries came with the product so you could use the game and remotes right away. I will say I was very amazed with how realistic this is. You really feel like you are in the Games! You also can sync this up to your phone and watch what the player is seeing. It makes it more interesting.A couple downsides to it: 1. One of the batteries was bad or exploded as when you opened the remote backing, it was sticky and there was the white powdery substance that you see from bad batteries. It is all in the remote. It has not affected the use but for the money spent, I was a little upset. 2. You can’t create more than one profile on this. I set this up prior to Christmas morning, and set it up under me. I found out when the kids wanted to play, that they aren’t able to have their own profile. As far as I can tell, if you play a game and leave off somewhere, it’s going to pick right back up where it was left off when someone else plays.Overall, I’m very satisfied with this product. It def gets you moving and provides some exercise. It has been a good device for me and the kids to do stuff together.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 January 2020

one_reviews_text: The little dome on the mountainside atmosphere that you are in while accessing the menu is worth the price right off the bat. I didn't want to give my son (whom this was a bday gift for) a turn on it. I loved it. Games can be pricey, but comes with the territory I imagine. I have a feeling this is going to be a fun and wonderful investment. My only complaint is the fact that upon opening the box, I discovered that there was absolutely NO paperwork included. Nothing. No user manual. No quick reference guide, no warranty card. Nothing. It is my fault for not checking if it was included. I assumed it would be, given it is a gaming device, but assuming is notorious for incorrect outcomes. All in all, I believe we will get years of enjoyment from this fun gadget.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 July 2020

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 May 2019
review_title: Best VR headset on the market

one_reviews_text: The Quest is a very impressive machine and actually feels like VR is ready to really take off. The ability to setup anywhere is great especially sticking it in a bag and heading to a friends house. As the software updates more features become available like pass through+ and soon finger tracking without controllers. There are tons of pros but using it I have found downsides that are by no means make it a dealbreaker.Cons:- Needing a smartphone to set up the quest even if you only need it once why not just eliminate that step all together.- The way the headset tracks the controllers is the four cameras on the corners on the front side of the unit. There aren’t any on the side so it will lose tracking which for some things makes it frustrating-The touch controllers would have been nice to just have rechargeable batteries instead of AA batteries. I would have probably bought a base station for it if this were the case and I’d definitely recommend getting some rechargeable AA’s.-Not being able to stream the image to any smart TV or computer is annoying. I understand it works if you pick up a chromecast TV attachment and it can stream to smart phones. Like I said, just seems annoying since just about everyone has a smart tv but not a chromecast it’s just one more useless thing to buy.- The visor part that your head rests on is cloth based and it absorbs all sweat and will feel drenched after strenuous activity on Beat Saber, won’t be much passing around the headset then.Pros:- If you have a decent computer and a good home network you can have a untethered PCVR and it works brilliantly, google it there’s multiple ways to accomplish this even for free.- Oculus/Facebook is relentlessly updating the software to add incredible featuresThere are cons that I went into detail about I feel like a lot of people will run into them. The pros which I only listed a few of tons more, by far outweigh the cons I’d recommend anyone to try out VR with the Quest.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 October 2019

one_reviews_text: First off this is a great product really entertaining for friends and family it becomes the life of the party and has endless hours of play time to give. that being said getting into the PC aspect of it. there is some limitations with this product. since there are no sensors (outside the ones built into the headset) given with said product. a lot of occulus Rift games played through link can appear really clunky slow and not fun to play. Gorn, Blade And Sorcery are good examples. two handed weapons are impossible to use because your tracking goes bunk any time you move out of the angle. Gorn isnt terrible but B&S was very apparent. even single handed combat in B&S was a chore and really not solid or smooth at all. now is this really a deal breaker? not really it plays games like walking dead saints and sinners pretty decently and smoothly. its a great headset and since the Rift has been sold out for ages and hardly comes back into stock this is a good alternative IMO. shooter games run great like Pavlov and you'll be able to access any VR game but take that with a grain of salt because you wont get the best tracking possible without room sensors. i believe you can purchase and link to the headset but you'd have to look for guides. if you want the best of the best for your PC you might want to spend the extra money to get an index or Vive but its up to you. if you are only going to be playing melee combat games with intensive tracking id do some more research to see if this is best for you. if you are casual maybe play some VRchat or TWD some shooters id go for it. it is kind of a steep price range though if you will only be using it on PC id just wait until you can get your hands on the Rift. or go with another headset. if you plan on playing it with friends in the living room or with family this is definitely the headset for you
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 August 2020
review_title: Fun but has some problems if you plan to use for PC as well

one_reviews_text: After the first day, I feel like there is already so much to do in this realm of virtual space! There is not much you can't do, provided this industry keeps growing! You will definitely entertain friends and family by letting them put it on and let them experience this wizardry for themselves. The only issue I have had with it is getting a little motion sickness from trying to move with the control sticks rather than teleportation or just walking around. There are not many games that make you move with the control sticks, so that is good.Your guardian space , the space in real life that you make so that you don't bump into things, is really neat! You can peek our and see the real world in black and white with your headset on...no need to take it off! I played about 2.5 hours straight, and at that point, it does feel a little heavy, but I will make sure to take breaks more often in the future. I like testing the limits of things (even if I try to catch a frisbee above my head and smash my hand into the ceiling...yes I am a tall person!)I hope whoever reads this review understand just how much fund you can have in a non-real place. There is so much to do already, with more to come! You can hang out and watch movies with your friends and talk like they are right there. I think this will be the next step with social encounters. Anyways, get yourself one, and have a blast! You won't be sorry!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 May 2019
review_title: Virtual Reality is the great escape!

one_reviews_text: The Quest is a really great headset. The only real downside is that the graphics and refresh rates are lower than what you would find in PC headsets, but it is by no means unplayable and doesn't ruin the experience at all. The wireless capabilities are nice if you want to bring it to other people's houses or if you just don't want to deal with wires getting in your way. I have tried the Rift S and it definitely has better graphics quality compared to the Quest but the benefits of the Quest outweigh that negative. As for the storage, the 64 GB is plenty and especially with the option of PC linking, I see no reason to go for the pricier 128 GB. Overall, it's an amazing headset that is well worth it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I've been interested in VR since the very beginning, but, as a younger person just barely out of college, I never had (and still don't have) the means to afford $800+ setups. I finally decided to treat myself and grab the quest, and man, I am absolutely blown away.As soon as I put this thing on my head, I was smiling like an idiot. As my first vr experience, having only seen it through YouTube videos, the simple joy of feeling totally immersed and interacting with things around me was mind blowing. I couldn't help but pass it over to my girlfriend who was watching, and my dad a few minutes later, and they all had the same reactions: big, goofy grins.And that's what makes this device in particular so special. Out of all the VR setups, this one has to be the most social. With the quest, you don't need to have someone follow you to your bedroom where your pc is, or worse, lug the pc somewhere else. Just take the headset off and pass it around. It's so simple and fun.As someone who has never used VR before, the graphics in most games I've played look great. You can tell they've been toned back in some places, but honestly, the games are too fun to care. If you're coming from a pc, you'll probably see a graphical downgrade, but this device isn't meant as an upgrade. It's an alternative.Recently, oculus just announced the icing on the cake, making the Quest possibly the most versatile VR headset around. Soon, they'll be rolling out Quest Link - if you already have a gaming pc, you can connect (via their premium cable, but still...) to a pc and play full, pc oculus games. Not only that, but in an update, they are rolling out hand tracking. No need for controllers at all. Just your hands. Pretty cool, and I had no clue when I bought this. Now it's essentially the Nintendo switch of VR. Best of both worlds.I'll finish by saying this: if you have been interested in vr, but don't see yourself getting a gaming pc and $800 headset, then this is the device for you. Full stop, best bang for your buck. Just get it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 October 2019

one_reviews_text: I got the 128 GB version from Amazon.Pros:The guardian system is cool and I DID NOT GET ANY MOTION SICKNESS with the 6 degrees of freedom (6DOF) that comes with this front-facing cameras guardian system. However, it's probably related to programs that took advantage of the 6DOF.Vadar Immortal would best summarize as YOU FEEL LIKE YOU ARE THERE! It's only episode 1 but it's just incredible!.All the games I tried were interesting and fun. It's much bigger then what you see in the pictures. The pictures just show the frontal view. You feel the presence and the movie theater screen looks like iMax. Network videos and pictures ran well. 3D videos also work. Some of the games involve significant physical effort.Cons:The headset is front heavy. You really feel the weight when watching videos but not so much when playing games.Facebook/Oculus should consider making an improved version of "Oculus Quest Standard Facial Interface" as an aftermarket optional accessory to help dissipate the weight of the headset especially at the areas underneath the eyes. That'll drastically improve the user experience.Screen door effect is noticeable during video watching.Video quality is not that sharp especially in slow gaming environments when you start focusing on the details.Summary:Incredible technology with tremendous fun factor! The feeling of presence and lack of motion sickness with programs that take advantage of the 6DOF are amazing!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 June 2019

one_reviews_text: Purchased this just in time for Christmas, and oh man I think it was a mistake...it’s just too much fun! Haha! My son is addicted to the boxing games on here and can break some serious sweat while playing. My brother loves the beat saber game. My nephews both play Super Hot and Vader Immortal. We are planning on getting a second one for the household so we can do some local multiplayer stuff! The headset is made of great quality. It’s comfortable out of the box, but I can see why they make so many other accessories for it. I don’t know whether the ease of use or the family time we enjoy while playing it is the best thing about it. I guess you’ll have to try it for yourself and see what it does for you! Enjoy! We have the 64gb version.

one_reviews_text: Just gave it 4 stars as I haven't actually played with it enough to see what all it can do.The item is really amazing in the fact that it's SO different and really fun.The hand controls to pick up items takes a bit of practice and getting use to. The head piece fits nice and if a person wears glasses it can be adjusted to accommodate your eyeglasses without damaging them so that's a BIG plus. The roller coaster ride through the dinosaur jungle made me quesy but that's just me.My husband loved it and the boxing game and got a good work out! Lol..Iam excited to watch some television shows in my virtual living room. All in all I can see many many fun evenings sharing with friends and family and getting to know more about this item and buying various games! This item is going to be a blast.I just danced with an alien a few minutes ago! Buy it! You won't regret it!

one_reviews_text: My God. I ripped my hair out for a week trying to figure out how to get Oculus Link (still beta) working. Now that it's working tho, WOW. I have a gen 1 rift, that I'll be giving to my roommate, as this headset does it all.This replaced my plug-in rift, and doubles as a mobile VR system. Couldn't be any happier.Advice for those just setting up Oculus link.Get all the latest drivers/firmware for your graphics card and quest. Make sure it's all installed.Make sure you have the best USB cables you can get your mitts on (along with ports on your PC that can supply the correct amperages)Turn off the Nvidia screen capture thing (can't remember what it's called, but it's in your get force experience)Quest link has been running flawlessly on my Alienware m17r5 laptop.Again. Quest is pretty neat. Couldn't be happier.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 December 2019

one_reviews_text: So, I own the Vive, and thought this would be a good supplement for bringing to friends' houses to show them VR, or to have something for the living room.  For those instances, it's fantastic... if you don't have a PC VR setup to know what you're missing, it's really hard not to love the Quest.  If you have a 5' x 5' space and a computer capable of running the Rift S though, get that, it's so much better.  Still, for those with deeper pockets, this might be perfect as a supplement, or to do things like play beat saber in a different room in your house.  I had to decide between one or the other, and having a PC capable of running the Rift S, I just felt like I was giving up too much with the Quest.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 September 2019
review_title: Great intro to VR, but not if you have space and the rig for PCVR.

one_reviews_text: Was thinking about getting into the VR world. I have a pretty beefy gaming pc in my basement, but I didnt want to have to hang out down there every time I wanted a friend or the wife to play beatsaber. Read that the quest is going to support tethering to the pc, but can also be used completely stand alone which is the best of both worlds. The only downside is the 72hz refresh rate, but based on comments by Carmack that it can technically support up to 90hz, I am expecting the modding community to figure that out at some point, or have Oculus officially update that. Seriously great purchase and well worth the price of admission. We bought a second one for the wife 1 day after getting mine.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2020
review_title: Beware, Severe motion sickness is possible.

one_reviews_text: The good:I love my headset, its by far the most complete VR hardware and software package on the market (of it's time) and has amazing performance for being a mobile VR headset. Wireless VR via Virtual Desktop is shockingly actually really usable and allows me to play Half Life Alex while my PC is across the house.The bad:I had to stop using my headset last year due to the fan geometry in the headset drying out my eyes and the skin around my eyes. I think it's due to the fan in the back of the headset sucking air from around the eye pieces and blowing it out the front of the headset. It's great since it keeps the graphics processor cool and the lenses  free of fog, but since the only real opening is next to the nose, the air is sucked in around the nose piece, hits the users eyes, and then flows into the headset. This strips moisture off the users eyes and means I can only use it for 30 minutes max on dry days during the winter. I would just ask the hardware engineers working on these headsets to consider users in dry climates and add vents around the headset to avoid air having to enter next to the nose piece.-Thanks!Colin
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 April 2021

one_reviews_text: For the most part, we are quarantine because of Covid, and for my health concerns my son is not out playing like he should be.  I wanted to buy him something to make up for his sacrifices.  I'm so glad I did.  He got it Saturday and is actually participating in team sports that require some light physical activity.  He's also interacting with other kids.  I tried them on and they are amazing.  I wasn't expecting them to be so good.Some warning though, older kids and young adults who have never grown up, swear when bad things happens.  Every once in awhile, they'll drop an "F" bomb. but I can hear everything that is said.

review_title: My son is having a great time.

But however I did not find myself using it daily or nearly as much as I thought I would, but its great for parties.  My ONLY complaint is how much every game is on the oculous store opposed to the steam VR store, you can use this headset for PC VR games outside the oculous store but you would have to buy Oculous Link or a alternative which will put you 30-80 dollars in the hole ontop of this. Which have some problems of its own. But its a great way to show how far we have come in Virtual Reality. Another Almost Perfect

Now, I get this popup telling me to log into Facebook since Facebook officially bought Oculus.  No.  Just, no.Games are Ok.  I do have issues with some things. like reloading a pistol. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2021

one_reviews_text: Stay away from Oculus headsets until they get their quality control up to par. I've owned 4 Oculus headsets, starting with the Go. Every one of them has had issues.The Go (from Walmart) arrived with a dead pixel, so I sent it back. I liked the technology, though, so I decided to upgrade to the Quest on the next go around.My first Quest (from Amazon) arrived with a swath of darkened pixels at the top of the left eye. It was very disorienting, so I set that headset back. They were out of stock, so I had to accept a refund instead of a replacement.About a month later, I ordered my second Quest (from Walmart). It arrived with a frozen/dead green pixel, popping sound issues (or no sound at all), and would randomly freeze and crash. I was busy, so I didn't thoroughly test this headset. When I realized there were issues, I had missed the return window by 1 day.So I sent that headset in to Oculus for repairs. The RMA process was easy enough, but what I got back was another faulty unity (directly from Oculus). This one arrived with sound issues, and recently, the tracking has started to malfunction.What are the odds that all 4 units that I've owned would have issues? They obviously have some serious quality control problems. These headsets are not worth what they're charging for them. Not at this failure rate. I'd stay away from Oculus until they get their stuff together (if they ever do).
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 November 2019

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest is amazing! NO WIRES! Many say it is uncomfortable and I can agree but everything else that comes in the package makes up for its faults. The Oculus Quest can play many games and looks AMAZING with its OLED display with the 1440x1600 display! Though the refresh rate is lower than other headsets, it is not noticeable at all. Tracking is insane especially since it has no external sensors. Finally the setup, THE SETUP IS SO EASY! Takes less than 5 minutes to set up and you can begin playing. All the other times after the first, you just put the headset on and you're in a whole different reality. YOU WILL NOT REGRET BUYING THIS!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 December 2019
review_title: This is the most amazing thing and will be a big part of the future's technology!
