I own 5 VR headsets (including a Vive pro) and I use this one more than any of the others.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 November 2019
review_title: Truly AMAZING VR device; but expensive games

one_reviews_text: This review comes from someone who has tried a bunch of VR headsets and owned a PCVR - Oculus Rift. I was a sceptic about it but wanted to see what the wireless freedom got me compared to PCVR. I will be getting a second one for multiplayer and getting rid of my original Rift.This is a game changer. If you are considering it, go for it. Everyone I have introduced this to in the last week has said they are buying one. The ease of use and wireless really out way any of the (small) cons. The quality of games is much better than I anticipated. My 11 Year old son and 5 Year old daughter use it like crazy. You put it on and within seconds you are in VR and launching whatever game/app you want. Oculus knocked it out of the park with this one.I added a battery pack to it to extend playtime. It charges while playing and we got about 5 hours total out of it while we had a bunch of people over sharing it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 May 2019

one_reviews_text: I don't even know where to begin. This Virtual Reality Headset is top of the line. Anybody looking for more freedom in virtual reality will enjoy the guardian boundary (similar to Steam's Virtual reality boundary). The tracking has gotten much better in the past update bringing tracking to be more reliable and accurate. The lower refresh rate (in comparison to other headsets) does not decrease the immersion you will enter. I've gone hours at a time playing vr simply because I was so immersed and lost track of time. Games like Beat Saber will not have issues tracking as long as your hands aren't behind your back for too long.Some cons:1. The slightly smaller game library may put off some people, but many game developers are introducing their games to sideloading through sidequest.2. Oculus has been denying many developers from their store library for some reason. Games like Pavlov VR were denied resulting in them being forced to use sidequestPros:1. Incredibly immersive, and fun2. PC VR streaming is possible after jumping through a few very small hoops3. Ease of use. This headset can easily be moved from one place to another and set up within 30 seconds.4. Great way to spend time with family and friends. Although you will have to purchase (if not already owned) a Google Chromecast 3rd gen or newer.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 July 2019

one_reviews_text: I am surprised at the quality of the standalone VR experience.  The real bonus to this device is that you can connect to a gaming PC and use like an Oculus Rift S. And.. if you have a little technical know how you can get that feature working wirelessly! Mind blown! I would definitely say that as of 4/2020 this is the best bang for your buck for VR. It's not going to give you the visuals of a Valve Index but it almost does and for $600 less and has the standalone feature! If you are looking to get into VR this is the way to go right now.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 June 2020
review_title: Best VR bang for the buck for 2020

one_reviews_text: This thing is wild.  My kids saved up their money to buy it.  I don't tell my kids what to spend their money on, but I was pretty sure this would be a waste.  Not so...  Not at all.  It's wildly entertaining.  It's stand alone so it knly needs a wifi connection.  It comes with a ton of demos so you can try things out (pretty in depth) so you can find what kinds of games you like (puzzle, shooter, Rollercoaster) and the games are pretty inexpensive.  My kids have enjoyed the crap out of this thing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 October 2019
review_title: Absolutely worth the money.  You gotta see this.

one_reviews_text: Ok so let me explain .... I don't know much about head sets .. my friend let me use his and and it had no problems .. this one in the other hand kinda wants me to restart it a few times it kinda freeze's now idk if my friend just got lucky or if I'm unlucky but I gave it a 4 for that reason now when it is working it works good .. idk I kinda hope it was just having a hickup during the setup process
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2021

one_reviews_text: You can sideload a ton of additional apps and even stream PC VR games to the headset! I wasn't expecting this functionality when purchasing, but it works great if you have a good PC and network capable of handling the data (5ghz AC router recommended)I got Skyrim VR, Space Pirate Trainer, Google Earth and Rez Infinite working via PC streaming. The apps available in the Quest store are good as well, though may be lower fidelity than the PC version. I'd personally recommend Beat Saber, Superhot and Vader Immortal
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Minus the way Facebook scumbagged the games forcing you to only be able to play games from their store, even going so far as making Virtual Desktop remove the ability to stream games specifically off of Steam. The headset itself is great, but the downside you may find is the games are smaller scales of the original. They left that out entirely before launch as well. Those factors aside the headset is still wonderful at what it does. You can play anywhere and my kids absolutely LOVE their game time. Some titles are cross play from the Rift, some, not all. Also more reason to purchase from the Oculus store. I will check if titles are cross play before I purchase them. Sometimes it requires a little hunting since they havent quite thought ahead to put that in an easy to find spot every time. Half rambling probably but I do highly recommend for the kids or yourself if you don't have a decent PC for a Rift.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 July 2019

one_reviews_text: I am female, 60 years old and have had so much fun with the Oculus Quest!! My son is stationed approximately 6,000 miles away. He has a Quest as well. We have played paintball in rec room and a few other games. Most awesome experience ever! I talk to him, his avatar even smiles when he smiles! Wow, technology! I am petite so my only complaint is the general fit of the headset. Other than that, fantastic and so much fun...even for an older person like myself.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Absolute Garbage! I have nothing good to say about the Oculus Quest all in one VR headset. From the moment I received this, it was a headache. The headache didn't go away until I sent it back. No, wait, it's still there. Caused by just the thought of it.I'll start this rant with its weight. It weights 1.5 POUNDS! Way too much for anyone's comfort. You the consumer will have to spend at least an additional $150 dollars to make it comfortable enough to wear for just a short period of time. Then, the odor! Something in its materials just absolutely stinks. That alone made me want to puke.The software is nothing more than a means for Facebook/Oculus to gather information about you, or any person whom uses the headset, to tailor their ads and slap you in the face with it. Its buggy, it lags, its choppy. My list of negative adjectives goes on for days.MAKE NOTE OF THIS: If you are a Simmer, ie: you play simulation games such as Digital Combat Simulator or Microsoft Flight Simulator, this is not the VR headset for you. STAY AWAY! DO NOT PURCHASE THIS HEADSET! The effort, work and software that MUST be downloaded/sideloaded to get the headset to work in those environments is monumental. Definitely not a "plug and play" device.Lastly Facebook/Oculus, DO NOT reply to MY review with your corporate "contact our customer service/support, we'll be happy to help you". It will be nothing more than confirmation that you manufactured a (add your own expletive here) product that serves your purpose and not those of your customers.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Followed the rebirth of VR from 2012 (duck tape prototype, Dk1 etc.) yet never pulled the trigger on buying a headset until now. The portibility and convenience of just being able to throw it on my head and transport myself to other worlds instantly is amazing. I am 42, have kids and have very little time to game. The half hour I get just to therapeuticly pop the quest on my face is...well...theraputic. Wander is my favorite app. Moss, Super hot and Space pirate also help me forget (my) stressful world for a while.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2019
review_title: Easy, transporting, theraputic. Love my Quest.

one_reviews_text: I love how Oculus Quest is an all in one device without PC, i've always wanted to be able to port my VR headset everywhere.I was an original owner of the OG vive and still love it, but now i can bring a more portable headset without having to lug around 2 base stations, 2 controllers, a bunch of wires, and a laptop/PC for its use.The cost is like purchasing a console, i see no downsides except that i have to repurchase games that I want to share when porting it around.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 August 2020
review_title: Love how its a all in one device

one_reviews_text: Hello, i have that great device, but I'm not happy coz they ignored only Quest for some -% summer discuss. I have only one VR devise and Oculus just not add some sales for my own device. Now i don't want to buy any apps from the store coz they just ignore my device and i don't want to buy the game for Rift and again for Quest! This is the same game, why i should buy it two times? Also, not a lot of games for Quest and price is near 30$ and without any sales!+Two stars only for the great and stable Quest device, -three is for greedy marketing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 July 2019
review_title: Oculus just ignore Quest on summer sales and expensive apps..

one_reviews_text: I experienced VR the first time a couple of years ago, but the system required a high powered computer to run it. The Oculus Quest is a stand alone VR headset, operates on its own, no other equipment needed. The VR experience is very good, although I'm a relative newby, so I'm not really an expert. Lots of games/apps are available as demo downloads and you get a real good idea whether or not you want to spend the money on the full version. A little spendy, but a huge jump up from the Oculus Go, from what I've read. Go for it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 April 2020

one_reviews_text: My son has thoroughly enjoyed his Oculus Quest since mid-August of 2020.  Games have been fun, overall VR experience is very good.  However.  The headset lost video mid-March and customer service is abhorrent.  No phone number to contact, emails go days before a response is received.  We have determined that the unit needs replacement, however I'm unable to receive any response from Oculus on my issue.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 April 2021

one_reviews_text: I don't think I've ever purchased an electronic gaming gadget that I've enjoyed as much as I had the Quest.  The quality of the display is unreal.  The sound is outstanding.  It takes a little getting used to wearing it, but that actually happens pretty quick.  As for learning how to use the controllers and playing the games that comes very fast.  I've found myself running the battery down a couple of times playing games while sitting, but that's actually a good thing, it makes me take a break from it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 May 2019

one_reviews_text: I bought the very first Samsung Gear VR years ago for use with the Galaxy Note 5 and was amazed then at the technology. I hated the lack of controllers at the time and the screendoor effect which ruined the visual aesthetic when watching Netflix or any video content.Cut to many years later and I decided out of curiosity how much VR technology has evolved. I'm really pleased with the Oculus Quest. The software feels much more polished and smoother. More immersive which is the main point of VR, and I absolutely love the controllers.The screendoor effect is still there and noticeable but definitely improved upon. Watching Netflix or 4K video content is actually enjoyable now. People have complained about the weight and lack of comfort while wearing the Quest but I find it okay. Took a little while to adjust the velcro straps but I am able to wear for a couple of hours without any real discomfort. I guess this will be an issue for some and not for others.Apps wise there are some good offerings on there at launch but very little free content. Expect to pay between $9.99 to $24.99 but there are a few free trials to help decide whether a game or app is right for you. The battery does roughly last as long as the advertised 2 to 3 hours depending on your usage. Gaming burns through the battery a lot quicker obviously. I like the long charging cable which let's you continue to play while charging. There is also an adapter if you wear glasses included in the box.The software requests that you mark out your playing area and does so with the camera sensors. This is genius and stops you from walking into walls or furniture. It also highlights where you have placed the controllers and its then easy to pick them up. The controllers feel ergonomic and intuitive. It takes a little while to get used to the button mapping but you'll be picking up objects in no time.Looking forward to playing with the Quest more over the coming weeks and excited to see what upcoming games and apps will become available.In short, this wont be for everyone and maybe a little too gimmicky and expensive for the very casual VR fan, but this finally feels like how VR was originally intended and is a great experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2019

one_reviews_text: One of the coolest things I’ve played with in my life. Personally I have a computer and I rarely use it in mobile mode. I am a very big VRchat fan and have always wanted to play with my friends in vr. It really has changed my life and is absolutely one of the best purchases I’ve made.In a quick summary of the product -Fun as just a standalone headset and am impressed by what it can do by itself, but I find it A lot more fun with the link. If I go to my friends house I’ll bring my computer with me to run it. Just because I want the little extra kick of seeing people’s avatars in VRChat WHICH  is all I play. I’ve played a few other free titles on the quest alone and they are pretty fun
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 February 2020
review_title: With or without link, it’s still hours of fun!

one_reviews_text: Teaching yoga for a decade I can see some great uses for this device. The gaming is un-real, graphics unbelievable, the most inter-active real life. The free apps are well worth downloading. Beware start with easy, the rollercoaster parks made me get an upset stomach the first time around. Chat rooms are easy to go in and out. Language issues can be a problem. You talk to people all around the world. Any you-tube that has a VR label watch them. You will not be disappointed. The price for the app games are reasonable priced. You have in your library forever. Chat rooms have some really interested people that have a lot of knowledge about computers. Worth every penny!.  T.D.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 August 2019

one_reviews_text: I bought a quest on release day in 2019. It’s awesome. Recently started getting black screen of death and I’m sick of factory resets. I can’t use quest two because I have a man size ipd. I ordered twice more off this seller here and both times received quest 2’s. Not sure why they’re advertising quest 1 and I keep receiving quest 2. Seller said it’s coming from Amazon direct so take it up with them. Decided to not waste my time and I ordered a 128 gb used off Marcari. Hopefully it’s good to go.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 June 2019

one_reviews_text: This product failed after several months of use.  The company provides no means of contact besides a customer support email address.  Response to inquiries is typically no response or "check back later."  Customer support instructed us to return it for repair after several attempts to reset and update software. Item was replaced with a unit which was defective on arrival.  We were given a return label to ship back the second unit.  The return was apparently lost in shipment.  The companies response was "check back later."  This has continued for going on two months. I contacted UPS and was told the shipment was lost, but I have no recourse since Oculus is their customer. I contacted Oculus with the information and Oculus' response for the past several weeks has been "check back later.  The company apparently has no interest in making this right.  In the mean time, my son has been without his vr headset for 6 months of the year he has owned it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 January 2021
review_title: Do not purchased. Defective product, terrible product support.

one_reviews_text: We've had fun taking turns playing games while casting to the TV.  A friend of mine has the HTC Vive, and honestly I couldn't tell the difference in how it looked in-game.  Admittedly the games in the Oculus store are less graphic intensive than the ones on Steam.  As an entry level VR setup, it's totally worth the money, and the 64GB has been more than enough for us so far.  With the latest updates (and the use of a USB-C to USB-C cable and a computer that meets the specs) you can use the Quest as a Rift, so it's really two in one!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 January 2020

one_reviews_text: Oculus has done a fantastic job of providing a totally new experience at a reasonable cost. The device is intuitive and exciting to use. Even the tutorial on using the controls is a fun experience in a virtual world ranging from launching throwing paper airplanes to launching hand held rockets to controlling a blimp through virtual remote controls. Whether you want to learn Tai Chi in an interactive session or box a virtual opponent or playing an addictive light sabre game, this device brings it all. I bought the 64GB device and have not found any limitations.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 June 2019

one_reviews_text: I am in love. I was nervous thinking this was going to be a close second to the phone "VR" sets. So far from it. This was a Christmas present for my son and I cant stop playing it, except to write this. Easy to set up and get right to it. Connecting it to Steam was a bit of a challenge but there is an additional purchase that allows you to mirror your computer on to the Oculus BUT we needed to purchase the additional cord to do that; that is the only draw back. Other than that it is amazing, awesome, and I'm going to get one for myself.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 December 2019

one_reviews_text: These are a lot of fun. If you are familiar with how cumbersome VR headsets used to be, what with all the cables and weight, so these (and Quest 2) are a breath of fresh air. They are fast enough for the types of games that run on them. Just make sure you have a lot of room around you, otherwise you might damage the controllers and/or your arms and legs.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2021

one_reviews_text: I’ve been using my Quest daily for almost a week now and I am completely blown away by what Oculus has achieved here. Everything worked flawlessly roughy out of the box (tracking, setup, sound, etc.) The graphics have wowed me despite this being a mobile chipset and the sensation of presence is extraordinary. Comfort could be improved but this is mainly due to the weight of the device. Battery lasts a satisfyingly long time and it can still be played while charging if necessary. Watching the Quest blow the minds of friends and family is really rewarding too!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019

one_reviews_text: I love this headset. I haven’t tried any others so can’t give a comparison. But I can say that I’m completely satisfied with what this headset has to offer. Being cordless is key- I don’t think I would be happy using one with a cord now that I’ve experienced the freedom. It’s also super user friendly. I play this for around 30 minutes every day which is perfect for me. I have found the headset to be uncomfortable- but I’m sure that is just a necessary feature when you have a stand-alone device like this.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2020

one_reviews_text: I've been waiting to get this for a while. Yes, the games are fun. But for me, it's the videos. Since I'm home so much from the pandemic, it's nice to just pop this on and take a trip to the beach. Plus my friend has one so we can play games together and do rec room, and get on a call via the headset while in it. The visual quality is a lot better than I anticipated as well.Yes, it could be a little lighter, but they are working on that. And, I get a little motion sick in some videos, but I have motion sickness in general. Nothing too bad though, it's barely noticeable unless I play for a while.Definitely one of my best buys of 2020 (not including toilet paper and sanitizer :p)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 September 2020

one_reviews_text: This new Oculus Quest is nothing short of amazing.  This is my first vr experience and i am glad i waited for this unit to be developed.  It is completely wireless and does not require a pc.  Set up was in minutes and after the update it ran flawless out of the box.  The demo is amazing.  This is a must buy for VR or gamers alike.  Tried to buy a second unit for multiplayer and it is sold out.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2019

one_reviews_text: Bought this for my teenager.  I love playing on it too when I can get it away from him. :o)Seems the Oculus is continually adding new games and updates.  I was a little worried about this when we first purchased as to if I was spending a lot of money on something that didn't have a ton of games like xbox or playstation does but it looks like Oculus is working on getting there!The even better thing about it is that it is giving my kid some exercise and movement while playing a game vs. just sitting down with a controller and looking at a TV screen.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 November 2020
review_title: Hefty Price but it is AWESOME!

one_reviews_text: Im a game developer and this was the best VR hardware I have used. The cable-less factor is a huge relief. It’s worth the compromise in performance. Also the resolution and frame rate are satisfactory but I believe in the future clarity and blurriness from hardware limitations will eventually be significantly better. Ideally a retina quality high resolution display with no optical magnification for pixels would be great but I doubt it’s possible without a tether and high end gpu anytime soon.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 September 2019
review_title: Best VR because of no cables

one_reviews_text: Amazing simply amazing I am not a true gammer okay mostly on iPad now days but man is this system awesome. No hookup to a computer if tethering to a console true free play in a virtual environment. My 10 almost 11 year old lived it plays by herself and my 5 year old plays with assistance (not move too much without guidence)Fun for the whole family games are not very expensive through Oculus app would recommend for a while family may pick up one more when side by side games come more available
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 February 2020

one_reviews_text: Bought this for my boyfriends birthday and it was my mistake that I didn’t pay attention to which model it was but the newer model with more GB is less money, I could have waited and spent 200 on the newest model that has WAY more GB. Don’t waste your money on an older model, I wasted over $400 on this POS
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 October 2021

one_reviews_text: I'm 42 and grew up on gaming devices like Atari, NES, Playstation, got a Switch a couple years ago, etc. As I've gotten older, I've gotten away from playing video games often. I've had the Quest now for close to a month and my son and I are having a blast with it. I would recommend watching some YouTube videos on certain games if you're hesitant on what to buy. But it is such a good time. Definitely recommended for places with plenty of room to move around. I have a small play area, but have managed to make it work. It is pricey. But it was money well spent for me 👍
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 June 2020

one_reviews_text: Yes, the resolution might be low, yes, the graphic aren’t good compared to the PC-powered VR headsets. But damn is everything else is so close to perfection. Most of the people giving low scores are people that have already experienced VR with powerful PC’s connected to them that cost thousands of dollars, so it’s not really a fair comparison. If this is how far untethered VR has come in just a few years, I can’t wait to see what it will be like in the next 5-10 years. Congratulation Oculus and Facebook for this giant leap forward for virtual reality.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019
review_title: This is it! The real beginning of mass-consumer VR

one_reviews_text: Its great, and the Oculus LINK (beta) makes this the headset over the Rift S to have. Just really hate that the Quest store is seperate from the Rift S store and SteamVR... But with the link cable, I can play Rift and SteamVR games no problem! Oculus needs to include the cable with this headset... paying extra for it is really lame.Controllers are good, but the battery covers keep sliding off. Tracking will fail if you play at night (or during the day) in a dark room, so you have to have plenty of light for the inside-out cameras to properly track things.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 February 2020

one_reviews_text: I had a rift, sold and bought this. I just built a GREAT VR PC. I prefer all my games on quest due to no tethering cable.  I only use Oculus link for games not available for quest, or high graphic games (stormlands, asgards wrath, etc) Downside: very little games go on sale outside of Christmas sales.  Plan on paying full price for most games.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2020
review_title: Now with Oculus link it's a no brainier.

one_reviews_text: Prior to buying this I had little experience using a VR headset but really wanted to get into them. A friend suggested getting this one as a start into the VR world. It has been great! The versatility of the quest is awesome. The one downside is that there are pc VR games I would like to play but as of now I haven't been able to because you can only play what is on the quest store. However, if you side load games and other content, it makes the quest so much better. I have not tested out the new link capabilities that allow PC VR games to be played. Overall if you are wanting to get into VR and don't have a super nice computer to run the rift or other headsets, the quest is for you!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 March 2020

one_reviews_text: Ive been really hesitant to buy a VR head set I thought the corded versions would be really awkward and I was unsure about this new wireless version because I knew some of the games wouldn't be available. The game selection isn't spectacular but there are a few really good games like Beatsaber and the new Vader Immortal that are very good.If you are on the fence because of game selection I would definitely say its worth keeping your eye on this because the wireless on this headset is REALLY nice.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Battery shipped with Oculus quest leaked in the controller which now does not work. Support says they will have someone contact me instead of just sending a new one. Kids are beyond disappointed as it was their xmas present which now they have to wait a week or two at best to use. Support was horrible about this and would not overnight a new controller so I'm returning. Update, right controller battery is also leaking. Oculus has no phone number so you have to wait until they contact you. Imagine the disappointment for what could be a simple fix e.g. overnight a controller.  We are now on day 3 with no contact from Oculus and the support chat team is effectively unable to do anything except reference the ticket. Again, no phone number to call.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 December 2019

one_reviews_text: I'm in my late 40's and feel like a kid again.  I'll never buy a tv game console again.  A lot of good arcade style content, "relaxing" VR content, and shooter games.  Game prices are much more reasonable compared to consoles (likely because they are downloaded).  My only complaint is the head strap.  It gives me a headache.  I'll be looking into an alternative, like a welding headgear mod.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Its Christmas day and we unwrapped it, packaging was excellent, both for quality and presentation. I set it up within minutes, which was very easy. We have been playing for about an hour exploring its feature as we are totally new to VR. Initial impressions barring unfamiliarity are that its amazing. The experience is immersive and honesty I'm in to it way more than I thought I would be. Youtube VR was great as well as several other free games and apps we've tried so far. Controller tracking is spot on and they are fairly intuitive to use, headset is comfortable but there is a slight gap by the bridge of the nose where light bleeds through. I haven't fully adjusted it for size as it was exitedly being passed between 3 different people. I have yet to connect it to our PC with the included link cable to test that out but again initial experience so far is genuinely a complete win. Totally satisfied
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Got this as a reward for my kids for doing a great job at school. I waited for the VR tech  to get better and I think this is the best so far. The fact that it is a stand alone item with the need for a PC was a huge plus for me. I am happy for what its worth.  The graphics are very good and the sound is a nice touch - would like an option for a bluetooth headphones - there is - but you need to go into Developer's Mode, not too convenient. Multiple player options would be a nice touch too - maybe in the future. But overall I really like this.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 July 2019
review_title: The kids and myself love it!

one_reviews_text: I probably would have just given this VR a 4 star rating but we had a problem with the charging cord. (Due to our own fault my son damaged it.) when I contacted customer service they went out of there way to make it right even when I explained the situation. They were very polite and resolved our issue quickly. I place very high value on companies with excellent customer service and was pleased with with how they responded.The VR itself is pretty awesome and my son spends hours playing on it. Definitely worth every penny. I did my research on VR before purchasing this unit It seemed like the best option and without cords or wires to get tangled in perfect for a 12-year-old kid. Only have a few games beat saber is my favorite. I would definitely recommend this to anybody who is looking for a VR.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 April 2020
review_title: Great VR, excellent customer service 5 out of 5

one_reviews_text: Such an excellent system that was purchased in August of 2019. Out of the box the system worked great however some little system glitches caused a clicking audio sound which was eventually fixed during october's update. This platform is exciting because of all the recent announcement in regards to finger tracking which will be available in 2020 and cross compatibility with oculus rift games starting in November.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 October 2019

one_reviews_text: i've been following vr headsets since the dev 1 kit. I've played with different ones over the years at work. I recently tried psvr and was not impressed. I did not know the quest existed till i was doing some research. pros:-no wires!-super easy to setup-tracking is amazing-guardian is super cool, switching into the gray mode makes it a lot safer than early headsets where you were blind.-no additional tracking cameras-hand controllers are intuitive and comfortable-games are reasonably priced.-immersion is incrediblecons with caveat:-graphics are a bit cartoonish, but, the immersion is so good that it doesn't matter.I'm very happy with my purchase.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 September 2019

one_reviews_text: I had a very good experience with VR. This was a remarkable upgrade from gear VR that I had in past.Pros:Good Sense of presence in VR gamesThe games feel real enough although they are running on a mobile processor.Excellent controller tracking.Good build qualityGood battery life and good roomscale trackingCons:Screendoor effect is quite reduced as compared to first gen rift/vive but its still there.The colors dont look as crisp as they look even on a 720p TV.VR movies dont look as good as VR games even the highest resolution ones.Movie watching experience was not good due to weight of the headset and also due to not good enough picture quality for the 1080p movies.I get mild headache when watching VR movies or 2d movies. Surprisingly I dont get any headache while playing VR games like beat sabre or space pirates.Costly VR gamesThis thing is not a replacement for your HD/4K TVs or gaming monitors. It is good for a couple of hours /day or week experience
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 October 2019
review_title: Good sense of presence in VR games

one_reviews_text: The oculus quest is a fine piece of equipment for its time.I like the concept of drawing the available area to walk in VR and the headset warning you visually when you're about to cross that boundary. The VR immersion is very good as long as you can actually walk to reach your objective, but immersion breaks a little when you have to teleport to a place further away. The field of view is advertised to be around 90 degrees, however in practice it is a bit less, because the headset is a bit finicky to adjust such that the picture in front of you is not blurry, and even with the best adjustment edges are still blurry. Additionally, pixel density on the screen is not high enough, so that one can clearly see all the pixels. They would have to increase pixel density 10 times to make it barely acceptable, and 100 times to make it decent. This is why I rate it 4 stars instead of 5. Nevertheless, if you imagine that you are looking at the VR world through glasses that have been touched a lot by fatty fingers which makes the image blurry, and the glasses have a fine black grid built in that make the picture pixelated, your brain will be able to extrapolate what the actual experience not mangled by the glasses should look like and you will be able to enjoy the VR experience a lot nevertheless.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 December 2019
review_title: Huge pixels and blurriness barely spoil this awesome experience

one_reviews_text: My first ever VR experience, and let me tell you, it's super fun, it feels so real, but my only complain is the battery life.. it lasts about 2-3 hours depending on what you do on it, either gaming, videos etc... I'd say videos will last longer but if you're gaming non stop, expect 2 hrs . I love it, my girlfriend wears glasses and it also supports it as well, she gamed so hard and nearly fell lol! That's how real it felt, 9.5 if the battery life was longer I'd rate 10, I highly recommend this , always clean the lenses after use as once it's damaged its irreversible.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 October 2019

one_reviews_text: I'm 78 years old and had never used VR before and was pleasantly surprised by the wide variety of interesting 360 degree content and its realism. I'm way past "shoot-em-up" games but I'm enjoying Bowling, Tennis, Ping Pong, Golf, visits to various cities around the world, Outer Space, climbing Mount Everest, etc., as well as Beat Saver and Racquet NX. My only disappointment so far has been Google Earth. While fascinating to use at a distance, when you get down to street level I expected to see a 360 degree photo of the streets being viewed but, instead, found what appeared to be painted cardboard mockups of each building. I don't think they are, that would have required an enormous effort, but that is what they look like. The headset is as advertised. Very good.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Product is fine. Works well, amazes people in my family, even those non-gamers. However, Oculus actively preventing game developers from offering discounts really pisses me off. While I do not expect a sale like Steam sales, but at the very least, allowing developers to offer discounts will be reasonable. However, Oculus wants to milk early users as much as they can, and they prevent any discounts on any games on the Oculus Quest. My Quest has been lying dormant for a few weeks due to the lack of discounts on games. Yes, I am price-sensitive on games and would appreciate some form of sales/discounts from time to time as the costs of the full price games will add up over time, considering the short length of the games plus this is not my only gaming system. Therefore, I can only give up to 3 stars at this time due to the attitude of Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 June 2019

one_reviews_text: So much fun! Been waiting for something like this. It’s going to get better in the future but it is darn good now. Room scale means you can really work up a sweat. I clocked in at 120-130 bpm playing games like Pistol Whip or Creed. Some games are more mellow. Some games fail to live up to a promise of entertaining game play (drunken bar fight made me laugh more thinking about playing it but was a disappointment). Games are affordable. If you play less than 2 hours you can get a full refund. So, if you’ve been holding out to try VR when it is affordable, supported, and accurate this is it. Jump in!

one_reviews_text: I love this little VR unit and I hope they make it lighter in the future. On the first day of opening the Quest, everything worked wonderfully. A few hours later and one battery recharge I noticed static and breaking of the sound in the right speaker like it had been blown out. I was super disappointed and tried another game and the same thing. I plugged in some headphones and it worked perfectly. I went back to the built-in speaker and the same issue. About 30 minutes later I started another game and everything was magically fixed! I went back to the other games where I heard the staic and distortion and it was also magically not there! My only guess is there is a loose connection somewhere in the headset.

one_reviews_text: (Edit: Changed title to a fun little one, as Facebook missed the opportunity for a great slogan for the Oculus Quest)I received my Quest on launch day.Here is the most important that you need to know:+The controllers are tracked pretty well+Battery is pretty good+Guardian system is really useful+Includes spacer for frames, for the visually impaired :)-You might have to repurchase some games that you've already purchased for rift-The room needs to have some form of lighting, otherwise the controllers will not track.I really cannot think of much negative to an overall positive system. I really do have hopes this device gives everyone a good chance to experience what Virtual Reality is like, without indulging in an expensive computer, with an already expensive headset.

one_reviews_text: The only reason I bought the quest is because it's currently one of the few VR headsets that can boast true wireless pcvr gaming but this is coming at a cost. Build quality is awful and the controllers are made of cheap plastic that's easy to break and you will likely experience controller drift within the first few months/weeks (get that customer service line ready and expect a lot of bulls**t) also the headset frequently bugs out and losses the environment so you constantly have to retrace your playspace (entirely a software issue and one that actually was introduced in the last few months). I hate the oculus itself, the company behind it, and the company behind oculus and the only reason this thing exists is because nobody else has bothered to make a wireless headset yet.

one_reviews_text: I have always been enthusiastic about the applications of VR, but do not have a good gaming PC set-up. The quest is a great headset providing the capability in experiencing virtual reality on a budget. Still has 6 DOF and many other great features including the ability to use it with your PC for better performance. Although not much is sacrificed in terms of performance since games through the store have been ported over directly for the quest. All in all I love it and have been able to introduce 5 people to VR over the weekend, all who had a great experience.Cons: slightly front heavy. Battery only lasts for 2-3 hours.Solution: Mount an external battery to the back of the headset. This will act as a counter weight and provide longer sessions.Seller Specific: Product was ordered through Endear direct. They sent me the wrong order and immediately realized and sent a RMA. Incorrect product was recieved on Saturday and mailed back the same day. The correct product was received the following day approximately 24 hours later. Great seller.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 May 2020
review_title: Phenomenal headset. Great to introduce people into VR with the easy portability.

one_reviews_text: This is a good product for newcomer of VR player like me. Wireless experience is essential for VR gaming and cinema, though the resolution is not so great as blur is very common on most of the apps. The battery is another concern for hardcore user like me, 1 hour of PokerVR or 2 hours of BeatSaber for maximum, it depends on the apps you play.Despite the aforementioned problems, Oculus is walking towards the right direction for future development of VR, it would be a dreaming gear for introducing new guys to VR if only there is better resolution and battery duration.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 June 2019
review_title: This is a good product for newcomer of VR player like me.

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest is a fantastic device that nearly nails the VR experience. The controller tracking and head tracking are nearly flawless. The graphics, although not what you'll get with a high-end PC, hold up surprisingly well and don't negatively impact the experience for most games. The resolution, one the the most important metrics for immersion, is impressively high for a stand-alone device. Exploring 3D spaces untethered from a computer provides a level of freedom and immersion you can't get on a traditional VR headset. It's hard to express how good this product is for the price. Buy it, show it to your friends, and fall in love with virtual reality. You will not be disappointed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 October 2019
review_title: Oculus Quest - VR for the masses

one_reviews_text: I received the unit Today May 21st.  I played on the psvr in the past but never liked the wires.  I get to play SuperHot and Robo Recall on the Quest. one_reviews_text: It is amazing. No wires. I think it looks better then the psvr maybe not as detailed but definitely clearer. It has a lot of great games available right away. It has only been a few weeks and we have two more.The roomscale set up easy and amazing been playing in my garage with so much room. Been walking around in superhot. I have played almost all launch titles. By buying and testing them out then returning the one i didn’t care for. All of them play pretty good accept boxvr something felt off in that. The tracking is pretty good it gets lost behind your back if you move to slow in some games, or move it to close to your own face. I have not had any problems with the vr slipping off of my face. Now the controllers are awesome love the joysticks the tracking in most games picking up and throwing things feels great. I did have battery case open on me one time in beat saber but other than that they are awesome.  Now the things that stink short battery life on the headset mostly 2 hrs. Then the controllers they take two aa batteries. So you have too buy those every once and a while. The speakers on it are ok I like my head phones better but they add a wire to get choked by. Some games cost a lot wait for sales I hope.Great games to get if you only want to spend 100 more bucksBeat saber 29.99Superhot  24.99 I thinkVader  9.99Creed  29.99

I am almost top ten in EVERY beat saber song in PSVR and found that I cannot come close to my scores due to lag and tracking issues.Next, the controllers. If you move too fast or grip too hard the magnetic backing will easily come off. I also found myself hitting the “home” button anytime things get too crazy in game.Again, if you want to max out the capabilities of a system this NOT the system for you. If you are looking to share time with friends and family and to simply enjoy Vr, the. This system is for you!

one_reviews_text: I am a child of the 80's and remember the day vividly when my parents purchased an Atari. I was so excited! Purchasing the Occulus Quest brought that feeling all over again. And I'm middle aged....and a "girl".  I have never been much of a gamer but I am in the therapy world ( Rehab/Pediatrics) and I see so many amazing uses for the Quest with Autism, CP , chronic pain and Stroke population .  I even did a presentation at work and let all my fellow employees try it. I use it at home for research and relaxation ( Wander/ Ocean Rift/ National Geographic) or exercise ( Beat Saber) and creativity (Tilt Brush).  I cannot wait for more apps to come out.  Very easy to set up. Allow yourself time to adjust. Any initial vertigo went away for me over time. Your brain adapts to the virtual world. You won't regret your purchase.

one_reviews_text: The Quest, with its amazing sense of immersion, portability, long battery life, solid build, is the beginning of a true  fundamental, mass-market shift in how we consume entertainment.  It's like being around in 1900 when the world only had radio and still photos, and someone came up to you and said, "oh my gosh, I just saw this thing, it was a picture but it was moving."  You wouldn't have known at that moment that everything was about to change.  We're at one of those moments now.  Plus, it's just cool and fun as all get out.  Buy one.  In a year everyone will have them.

one_reviews_text: First off, love this headset.Pros: portability, full mobility, more than surprisingly solid tracking of both position and controllers. This headset has a surprisingly similar feel to the PC version than to a mobile headset. Reasonable battery life and solid frame rate.Cons: Slightly more front heavy than I'm used to compared to other headsets, this disappears after awhile. In low light you can occasionally lose tracking, but it's highly uncommon. No current way to know your exact IPD adjustment, so some guesswork required.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I grew up playing the original NES and was fanatic about video games up until the Xbox 360. I got older, responsibilities mounted, and I had lost interest. I still kept up with the tech, but honestly I was mostly interested in the academics of it. I tried an HTC vive at a fun center and was impressed enough to go out and buy a VR headset. The team at Oculus nailed it; I mean, they absolutely nailed it. The games are incredibly immersive, and there are many educational apps as well. I feel like a kid again. I’m building a new computer so that I can take advantage of the higher graphics and games exclusive to the oculus rift (by using the oculus link cable). It is shocking that you can get this kind of tech for $400.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2020

one_reviews_text: The Quest is to VR as the iPhone was to smartphones. The fact that it runs VR games with 6 degrees of freedom, stays cool, isn't heavy, doesn't make any noise, and is fully self-contained is an absolute marvel.The display is higher resolution than previous generation, PC headsets. The built in speakers are phenomenal, and the operating system and entire ecosystem just works. Hands down the best VR experience to date.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2020
review_title: From the perspective of a VR Programmer, this is the best VR experience on the market.

one_reviews_text: No tethered headset can compare to the pure freedom the Quest offers. Simply turn it on and jump back in wherever you left off. VR was never about graphics, it's about the freedom to immerse yourself in another world. It's about the freedom to play games that are physically impossible. It's about the freedom to watch Netflix on an IMAX size screen. They are squeezing more out of this processor than I thought possible. The games Oculus allow into the store have a high bar to jump and I agree with their "only the best" approach.Obviously you can't compare the Quest's computing power to a gaming PC, but who wants to turn one on, let alone be tethered to it! Nevertheless, the screen is excellent and you can only marvel that they are squeezing so much out of the same processor as the Samsung S8. I think when historians look back, the Quest will be seen as the first real VR headset.Freedom and immersion to explore world we can only imagine. That's what we always wanted from VR. Quest delivers.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 August 2019

one_reviews_text: Really cool product. Oculus is constantly upgrading the technology to the Quest (versus time for a new platform). Most of the content I have tried so far is awe inspiring. Use Link to get higher res stuff with a high end gaming laptop. Action games will turn you into a Jedi and wear you out physically as well.

This being said, I believe a hardware issue has developed. It seems that after an brief time of playing, both controllers lose their tracking and float in space. It makes playing certain games rather difficult and frustrating. I heard Oculus support was rather not up to standard, and I have tried many different solutions to try and fix the issue. From a consumer standpoint the product is amazing, if the hardware remains operable.

one_reviews_text: If you have never experienced VR before this is the perfect introduction. the quality of the craftsmanship and the range of games will draw you into the emerging world of VR. If you are worried about motion sickness the games and apps are rated to give you a comfort level in order to build up you VR "legs".  You can start of with something like Wander which essentially drops you into Google street view so you can be on the Mattehorn while sitting on your couch. Then you can work your way up to more fully immersive and vertigo inducing games such as Climb where you are a rock climber actually climbing virtual mountains and the drop is stomach wrenchingly  realistic.I highly recommend this to anyone even remotely interested in VR

one_reviews_text: Returned after using for a few hours as I could sense the addictive power of this technology. I have no doubt that VR is the opioid of the future. If you are wanting to get into VR, I cannot think of a better device.  But if you already have a gaming PC with an established VR library (and don't feel like buying all your games a second time), the Rift S is an excellent alternative.

one_reviews_text: Owned a Vive, and the tracking here is just as good, which is surprising given it's inside-out, Great headset, which also doubles as a Rift replacement using the link cable (haven't tested that yet though). Only downside is that the battery life isn't great, but VR uses a lot of processing power so to be expected. Good line up of games also. Get it with Vader immortal deal if possible.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 January 2020
review_title: Great All in One VR Headset

one_reviews_text: I love it, played over 200 hours total and its great, a few minor issues I had with it solved with a bit more money.1. Super front heavy - nothing a sweatband streched over the head cant solve, and there are many very affordable solutions and others more expensive and more comfortable.2. The built-in face cover is terrible, no way around that, it hurts the skin and absorbs sweat way too much which makes it very unhygienic, the solution for me was a different face cover from "vrcover" which is a kind of leather cover, much softer and nicer on the skin and absobs zero sweat wich makes it very easy to clean.Other than that its fantastic and if you're willing to spend some time on learning how to sideload which is quite easy now, you can do a lot of great things with this!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 November 2019
review_title: Absolutely fantastic, 2 minor issues easily fixable that should have been included

one_reviews_text: Vr 360 videos r so blurry,  even with 100mbps connection. Only good for vr games. Total waste of money
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 July 2019

one_reviews_text: Es el equipo de realidad virtual que ofrece la mejor inmersion dentro del juego, libertad y sin límites. Realmente único, auténtico, cómodo. Lo recomiendo 100000%
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2019

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest is hands down THE BEST investment I’ve made in a long time! I’m 52 y/o and hadn’t exercised regularly in 30 years, but I enjoy the Quest (and Beat saber) so much that I play twice a day everyday.  I’ve lost 20 lbs., and have really improved my stamina and reflexes!  My only issue is that it starts weighing on my forehead and/or cheekbones after a while.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 June 2020

one_reviews_text: I was pairing the Quest with the Oculus App and all of a sudden the Quest started updating itself and I can no longer pair it again with the App, not until I switch it off for more than 15mins. (switch off and turn it back on immediately did not work)I thought everything is ready since I can finally pair it with the Oculus App but here come with the Wifi issue. The Quest keeps dropping out (and unpair with the App) and cannot search for any networks so I am pretty sure it is not about weak wifi signal as I saw nothing on the Quest. Googled it and saw quite a lot of people having the same issue. I have already submitted a support ticket to Oculus and I hope they could return a new device to me and bear the shipping cost. (FYI: I am in Hong Kong)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2020

one_reviews_text: My first videogame was Doom on a PC with 1 Meg of RAM.  Ever since then I've known what I really wanted:  a videogame that I could actually step into and experience.  And the Quest does it.  Wirelessly!  It is not yet the Holodeck on the Enterprise, but it is a glorious beginning.  I'm glad I'm getting in on the ground floor.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 October 2019
review_title: The VR I've been waiting for

one_reviews_text: Someday.  Soon.  We will all laugh at how huge and heavy the headset is.  It leaves big red marks on your skin - known as VR FACE in our house.  It's huge fun.  Chose the quest over the rift so we could use alone and with pc. Occulus link is still a tiny bit buggy but works well 90% of the time.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 February 2020
review_title: Get the Quest & Use Occulus Link for PC.  Best of both worlds.

one_reviews_text: Support is non existent if you have a hardware problem. left screen stopped working and I opened a ticket. I got a canned response after 2 days saying they understand i have some eye discomfort. Yeah, no. I need a hardware RMA. I will update if I get it RMAed.UPDATE: RMA processed and new unit is here today. Updating to 4 star Jul 21st ticket opened August 14th refurb unit received.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 July 2020

one_reviews_text: Let me tell you a story- The day I got this product I started playing like crazy and at 3:00am I was having a boxing match and while giving upper cut my hand went inside the ceiling and the ceiling came off with little blood in my hands. So the product is outstanding but be really aware about your surroundings, including ceiling 😜
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2020

one_reviews_text: LOVE my oculus quest!!! amazing graphics, great clarity, all in all a wonderful system with a wide variety of games for literally anyone and everyone. the ONLY downside for me personally, would be that i just have to take frequent breaks because sometimes the light gives me little headaches, but that could just be me!!! totally worth every penny and everyone in my family loves it!! even the parents!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 August 2020

one_reviews_text: Coming from a rift cv1, this is an improvement in almost every way. If you are a longtime vr fan, or if you have never tried anything vr before I recommend this headset to anyone. Also if you don't find it very comfortable I recommend looking up how to do the frankenquest mod as it improves comfort 10 fold. Also if you want to experience your pcvr games oculus link is coming in November which will allow you to connect the quest to your pc to play those games.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 October 2019

one_reviews_text: My son purchased this with money he earned. We had been to a few VR facilities and like the experience. Once we got this the whole family takes turns playing with them and everyone else watches. Its funny to watch people using it. The battery lasts a long time and connects very easily.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 April 2020

one_reviews_text: Next big step in VR, i am really enjoying it being completely wireless. Brings you much more into the experience. Resolution is really good for what this can do but FOV is a bit limited. Peripherals tend to get a little fuzzy and can give you a headache if you are not focusing on things directly in front of you.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Oculus lied and said you would never need a Facebook account. They force you to agree to new terms of service or brick your device! You have no choice but to follow the will of Mark Zuckerberg. Avoid like the plague.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 April 2021

one_reviews_text: Oculus just did it. They made the best VR headset.While the Oculus Quest doesn't feature the latest and greatest hardware ever for VR gaming, it does provide an amazing experience of headless standalone VR gaming that works EVERYWHERE untethered.The new anticipated Oculus Link option would close the loop and provide it all: Great gaming experience when you're on the go, unattached to your home PC, and extreme processing power when you get back home and connected to your powerful PC.I must say the headset just feel natural, everything works so smooth and so much fun to play.Very much recommended ! worth every dollar.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 December 2019
review_title: This product is just too amazing

one_reviews_text: I own the 64 GB one the other one is 500 but id say the 64 GB is fine for 400ProsBatteries IncludedThe headset is easy for most ages / sizes to fit onConsI don't recommend playing without the charger plugged in cause the battery even full can drain kinda fast for meyou have to pay for most games not much free gamesu will need to replace batteriesit doesn't come with a lens cleaner for the LensU can get sweatythis is all I have to say so far with a few hours of using it so I don't know all the pros / cons but its still worth it I guess cause u don't need a fancy gaming computer for most of the other vr headsets
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 August 2019
review_title: Id say its worth the price

one_reviews_text: This is the future.I know that PCVR has better graphics. I know that my PSVR for the most part does too. But that doesn't matter right now. What matters is that there is now a VR device that provides unbelievable experiences without being tethered to another device. Without the need of a 500$ PC or a 300$ console attached to it.Between the technology - the 6DoF, the tracking, the controllers - and the games - Robo Recall, Beat Saber, etc. - this is a fantastic entry point for those interested in VR. And it's great for those who are looking for a way to get their VR fix without being tied down to their PC or console.I buy a lot of tech, and this is one of the few times I've said after using something - This is the future.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019

one_reviews_text: This was my first introduction to VR. If you have never experienced VR before your mind will be blown. PERIOD.Getting the fit on the head right is some work. There's some great YouTube videos showing you how to properly do it. Watch them.Good luck if you play one of the horror games. I love horror movies, but living it and watching it are NOT the same thing. Maybe wear a diaper.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 August 2020
review_title: I like it, just be wary of horror games.

one_reviews_text: My boys love the VR but setting it up with a payment method was a nightmare. We set up each vr (we bought 2) with our kids names and emails. When we went to purchase a new game it wouldn’t accept my card because the account wasn’t under my name. We had to reset the goggles and when we did that lost the 3 free Vader immortal games. I had to buy them at that point because my son was destroyed that it was gone. It was extremely frustrating.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2020
review_title: Set up the goggles with email and card holder that belong to the same person!!

one_reviews_text: We loved it so much we brought it to a family gathering, and let others try it, and my Dad loved it so much he had my Mom buy it for him for Christmas! Graphics are amazing, I love that there are no cords! We can leave the ipad it's tethered to at home and still play on it at my Mom's house. Great buy! Such a great great buy!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 December 2019

one_reviews_text: We love the Quest. I grew up playing computer games but when I got married 11 years ago and had kids, that kind of stopped. But we got the Quest and even my wife--who doesn't usually like video games-- loves it. This thing really hits all the sweet spots for the size and price. All of the compromises they made are totally worth it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2019

one_reviews_text: As far as vr headsets go, I have to say this is currently the best by far. The ability to not have a computer and cables alone is worth it. Not to mention the fact of price or stock fit. The headset is great for someone getting into vr that doesn't want the burden of needing a new computer or for someone that doesn't want to have to setup lighthouses. I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone and everyone. Plus, if you still want to use it with your pc you can thanks to the oculus link update! The only thing I recommend getting with this headset is a power bank if you plan on using it for more than 2 hours at a time, but in all honesty I feel like 2 hours is a good session that you can have a break after.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I found it to not be as easy to use as it was advertised and was not as user friendly as I hoped. Guess I need one more user friendly Or simpler.

one_reviews_text: While my PC can render games with much higher fidelity - I'm simply having *more* fun with Quest.I can bring it with me to work, on vacation, play in any room in the house - and it's only a matter of popping the headset on.No drivers, no recalibrating sensors, no quirky OS updates. This is the Nintendo Switch of VR
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 May 2019
review_title: Absolutely insane - I'm selling my Oculus Rift (PC VR)

one_reviews_text: I thought I’d use this to play games. Instead, I mostly use this as my own personal IMAX theatre, to watch videos on YouTube, Prime Video, and Netflix.Sit in a swiveling chair, and the YouTube 360 videos are great analog fun. But YouTube 2D videos somehow seem more satisfying from the browser app than in the YouTube VR app.Watching Nirvana perform live on such a large screen was a revelation.

one_reviews_text: This system will blow your mind.The system can be taken anywhere and you’re able to create invisible fences which allow you to not run into TVs or furniture l.Graphics are good, immersion is great.Highly recommend.

one_reviews_text: I've been using this mostly for Beat Saber and Boxing VR. I'm ready for a larger variety of games including more multiplayer games but what it has is acceptable for now.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 July 2019

one_reviews_text: I tried VR a few times in the past but the need to be tethered to a computer with cables was always a bit of a deal breaker for me.  The quest is amazing with the level of performance is can fit into a  standalone headset! Full freedom of movement, take it with you anywhere, pick it up and be playing something 30 seconds later. These are are the things that make it appealing and approachable now. I love it and so do my wife and kids. Well worth the price of adminision compared to an Xbox or PS4.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 May 2019
review_title: If you have been waiting to jump into VR. Now is the time

one_reviews_text: A true step up from the traiditonal VR headset, the wireless / PC less feature makes a huge difference. Now anyone can enjoy VR without worrying about buying a $500 GPU, and taking all the sensors and their PC with them every they go. just strap on and play.One of The most impressive things was that, when you set your play zone, the headset keeps recognizes the area based on the camera feed, so next time when you put it on, the play zone is automatically set.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 November 2019
review_title: a big improvement to existing VR

one_reviews_text: I was skeptical at first when I heard that this thing had no wired connection to a PC. I figured itd be like last cordless phone headsets I had tried in the past. Basically, underwhelming and bleh. Boy was I totally wrong. This thing is awesome. It's like having PC VR anywhere anytime. No wires or computer required. Definitely took me by surprise that VR could be this awesome without being tethered to a computer. Anyways, definitely would buy again, without a doubt.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 May 2019
review_title: Skeptical at first, but this thing is amazing.

one_reviews_text: Perfect VR headset. Works mobile, I can bring it to school, a friends house, etc. with no hassle. No cameras or sensors to set up, all in one headset. The hand tracking feature is amazing and I hope to see more games on this system soon. Highly recommended over PC connected VR Headsets. Extremely comfortable and the graphics are extremely well for the weight and ram. The memory is perfect since most games are under a GB anyway, and you can just uninstall unused games. Definitely the best VR experience I've had.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 March 2020

one_reviews_text: I had to return mine because it had a weird permanent glare in the lens, almost like a stain. It wasn’t very strong and obvious but it still irritated me. On the other hand, the screen was okayish for gaming but not so much for videos. The videos were grainy and since you see “god rays” around white text on the dark background it was hard to watch with subtitles. I’m giving it 4 because overall they made it possible to have a decent standalone VR experience and the tracking was great (anyone who played with older VR sets would agree). So overall I think it will not replace your game console or TV but it’s still good to have it and start experiencing this new technology.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 September 2019
review_title: Will not replace anything but it’s good to have it

one_reviews_text: I had my quest  in less than a month and it started to develop stuck/dead  Pixels I got a refund to get another one . The new one had  permanent scratches and defects on the plastic ! The rubber was coming off the front cameras so I just got a refund . The console is probably the best  virtual reality headset on the market  But there’s  too many technical issues !
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 October 2019

one_reviews_text: A definite win for Oculus, they really knew what they were doing with the Quest. The controls, the graphics, the roomscale, everything is absolutely great. The only nitpick I have is the headset itself which is a little front heavy, meaning at times the headset may dig into your cheekbones and push against your forehead which will leave some marks and some soreness after playing for a while. The setup was quick and easy and I got right into playing within 10 minutes. If you've been looking for a VR headset and don't want to worry about the hassle of getting it setup, the Quest is the one for you. No regrets on purchasing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 January 2020

one_reviews_text: I purchased a quest to try out the wireless experience for VR, and I already own a Oculus rift CV1 from 2016.  Considering this is about half as much as I paid for my original rift, and that this doesn't need a computer, I cant recommend it enough.  The only downside is the graphics quality.  The graphics are impressive considering they are running on mobile hardware, but they dont really compare to an expensive gaming PC, but that shouldn't be a surprise.  The tracking quality is probably better than my rift, and is similar to the HTC vive, from my experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 June 2020
review_title: I cant belive how well this works.

one_reviews_text: Not happy with casting to iphone. Will only do it intermittently and will boot me off regularly. Has tracking issues with fast paced movements (Beat Saber Expert/+). Speakers blew after 1 hour and had major static mixed with sound. (Rattling). Rebooted and it went away but indicative of something bad.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019
review_title: Has flaws that I can’t overlook.

one_reviews_text: Oculus Quest offers the VR experience everyone has been waiting for. While it sacrifices graphical fidelity in some parts, what it gets back in trade is an unrivaled level of freedom in VR gaming. The headset has a battery life of roughly 2 to 2 1/2 hours, which is pretty convenient because average gaming sessions in VR do not normally last that long. After owning this headset for about two months, I can easily that I am very satisfied with this product as my very first investment into VR gaming.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 June 2019
review_title: Wireless VR Gaming Is Worth It

one_reviews_text: This headset is so good, its crazy. They've managed to pack a crazy amount of tech into such a small package, and it works so well. Its able to run all the killer apps and then some. SUPERHOT in particular is virtually identical to its P.C. counterpart. And the tracking is near flawless. If you already own a PSVR I would strongly recommend picking up a Quest. Also, you can do custom songs on beat saber. Also the lack of a cable makes every experience so much more immersive. 7/5, would recommend.

I now attract double the women that I used to before getting the headset (yes, I can make these claims because 2×0=0) ;)The problem I had with comfort when I first got it was easily solved with a headstrap from a random mobile vr headset I had laying around. Setup is easy and self explanatory, but you’ll probably need a teen or adult to assist children. The only draw backs that I’ve come across are the WiFi has trouble staying connected from time to time, the tracking can be slightly inaccurate at times, and its heavier than you’d think on your head.

one_reviews_text: Make sure to buy a link cable if you have a VR Ready PC.  This is probably my favorite buy of the year, I use it practically everyday, and if you are on the fence about buying this just take the plunge.  The quest is so much more than a gaming system, its hard to explain but everything in VR just feels more interactive and personal.  Want a big screen TV? The Quest can stream media and make you feel like you are at the cinema.  You can even watch media in a cinema setting with your friends in VR with an app, it's awesome.  The gaming is great; there is a bit of getting used to when it comes to motion sickness but it goes away with time.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2019

one_reviews_text: Gave this to my kids for Christmas - brand new devices and it doesn't even work. Won't charge. Waste of $400 if they won't fix. Contacted customer support today. Will update review if they take care of the problem otherwise it's going to get returned.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 December 2019
review_title: Doesn't charge out of the box - brand new device won't charge

one_reviews_text: Great system for the money. I would recommend for anyone starting out or a veteran VR player ready to go wireless. No separate computer required and totally wireless. While a more high priced system with a tied in high storage and processor computer could give better graphics and more storage this system works and looks as good if not better than some higher priced systems. A great starting point for anyone ready to delve into the VR world.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2019

one_reviews_text: Highly convenient when used as a stand-alone, just put it on and play!We’re only 7 days in and 3rd party PCVR streaming options such as ALVR are working impressively well (admittedly with the need for tweaking & optimising wifi connection between PC and headset). This almost makes wired sets like the Rift S redundant. Sure, latency will never be as low as wired, but visual quality with tweaked settings is breathtaking.I’ve found a good setup for ALVR is to have a dedicated wifi router (no other devices connected) next to my PC set to 5GHz with 80 MHz channel width (on a empty channel), then start a “mobile hotspot” from the PC and connect directly to that with the headset.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 May 2019
review_title: Awesome by itself, add 3rd party wireless PCVR and it might be the best HMD out right now

one_reviews_text: This unit was a Christmas present for my 13 year old, but I can’t get it away from the adults!  I can only say the virtual optics are stunning.  You do not have to put a phone in it, it is cordless, and there are hours of downloadable content available.  This is a cant miss upgrade for your gaming enthusiast.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 January 2020
review_title: Stunning immersion into wireless VR, with excellent build quality.

one_reviews_text: It is a fantastic product for when you want to play vr without having a computer or PlayStation and or tv near you. It can connect to a tv using a from cast or connect to your phone through the app, not the best vr headset for multiple Peale as you’ll have to keep adjusting the head strap to fit different heads.  It has the ability to side load apps and modify current ones which ads more capability. Doesn’t have the most power, so running some games may cause it to slow but handles all games on it well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 September 2019
review_title: Very fun and good for the price.

one_reviews_text: Great exercise, two sets working trouble free for a year with daily use. Battery compartment on hand controls could have better cover. Get you a recharger and some double a rechargeables. many more uses found. One kid does home school on unit, youtube and more.

one_reviews_text: Absolutely terrible product. I've completely wasted my whole Christmas tying to set up this piece of garbage. After hours of loading and having to look up how to do factory resets because it kept crashing I was finally able to set it up, but the screen always goes black after rebooting. Worst of all their is absolutely no customer service at all to contact. Just an email you can contact that says they will contact you in two days. I would strongly discourage anyone from buying this product or any Oculus product if they are going to sell garbage and refuse to offer any form of help.

one_reviews_text: A true all-in-one vr headset. I gave 4 stars for it.I buy Quest so that I don’t have to pay extra money for building a gaming pc and doing exercise while gaming. I have no regrets for buying this.But there are few things about the Quest.1) The front headset is too heavy when I put it on. My face and cheekbones got sore. Therefore, I made a counterweight to solve the problem.2) I have to dry out the facial interface after taking off the headset (I sweat a lot while playing beat saber). The facial interface is made of sponge like material. I wonder if it would be better to put a leather/water proof cover on it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 July 2019
review_title: Overall it good, just little flaws

one_reviews_text: It's the best independent VR headset in the market right now, there is nothing close to the quality and price right now.I'm a really VR fan, but I don't have time for preparing and maintaining computers just for VR, so, I wanted a device like this, the Oculus Quest, independent, no wired, good graphics, good battery, good FOV, small SDE, 6 DOF, hand controllers, etc., and it's better than I thought it was going to be, good a really nice games/apps.You'll enjoy VR with this headset.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 June 2019
review_title: Just the better independent VR headset in the market, period.

one_reviews_text: Setting it up was so easy. Amazing really came through in time for Christmas with their shipping! Back ordered for over a month ours came on Christmas Eve. Our Christmas day! (When we celebrate it) it’s defiantly the best present ever.

one_reviews_text: This device is pure magic, and I cannot understand how it can even exist as a standalone device. Yes - the graphics are ok, and for long session it's not so comfortable and the integrated Audio Speaker is meh...But for 400$ you get to take virtual worlds with you on the go.*THIS* is the future and it is amazing.It takes roughly 20 seconds to define a playspace and start playing - anywhere (as long as its not outside in the sun).Tracking is great for the most part, and Oculus are pushing update after update with sweet new features.In short - buy it, it's pure fun.

one_reviews_text: My son wanted a VR headset for his birthday so I convinced him to wait a few weeks to get the self contained Oculus Quest.  Boy am I glad he was understanding.  Not having to be tied down to a PC is great and the prices for games isn't as outlandish as I thought it would be.  Most of the games released with the Quest will run between $15-30 which isn't too bad considering Xbox/PS4 charge almost $60 for new games.  The graphics are great...just like if you were running one off of a PC.  Unless you have a tricked out PC, I would consider the Quest equal to other PC VR based headsets.  I really like that you can set a circle and if my son steps outside it, you can see the real world.  Hopefully that will mean, I won't hear objects crashing to the floor or him running into things.  I can't recommend the Oculus Quest enough.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 May 2019
